poem:
Title: "The Blue-Collar Tango"

In the rust-brittle belly of the beast,
Securing their allegiance is no feast.
Two men vie for the heavy-helmeted heart,
Campaign promises are but an art.
"Kitchen table" woes, Blood-oil that flows–
Siren songs of the red and blue undertows.
Elections are waged, as battles at night,
Each potential victor must 'choose his fight'.
